TopicTitle: Need recruits for a starmade faction (Nextech Enterprises Recruiting)

Articles.Content:
> 
> Starwhip, when i get the game, may i please join nextech?

You are welcome to join Nextech, I'll be on at 6pm GMT, I can recruit you in as well

> 
> Thanks! I like making the pretty part of things, I'm not very good at the systems and logic yet.

I can teach you a thing or two about systems. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Yep, it's a repeat image, but it's still a great example. Very efficient, very powerful. Not so pretty, but I can do better.
> 
> ![AD3w9XL.png](http://i.imgur.com/AD3w9XL.png)
> 
> 

What are some of the stats on the ships you've got there?

> 
> ;2134518']You are welcome to join Nextech' date=' I'll be on at 6pm GMT, I can recruit you in as well[/quote']
> Ok, cool! Just a warning, first, my internet sucks. Second, i am a complete noob.
Seeing as my streams have been going poorly, I think I'll be joining in a couple minutes.

> 
> I can teach you a thing or two about systems. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> What are some of the stats on the ships you've got there?

Oooh, pretty. Love the coloring.

The large ship is still being built, but it's hull alone was 180,000 blocks. XD

The smaller one to the right is a nice little battleship, 80,000 blocks, dual 4-tube lock on missiles, a nasty array of rapid-fire cannons, a cool million shields and a 100k shield recharge, plus twin jump drives, a radar jammer, scanner and tractor beam.

> 
> Oooh, pretty. Love the coloring.
> The large ship is still being built, but it's hull alone was 180,000 blocks. XD
> 
> The smaller one to the right is a nice little battleship, 80,000 blocks, dual 4-tube lock on missiles, a nasty array of rapid-fire cannons, a cool million shields and a 100k shield recharge, plus twin jump drives, a radar jammer, scanner and tractor beam.

The ship I posted above, oddly enough, is basically a smaller version of the 80k block one you just described. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

~62,000 blocks, 678,000 shield hitpoints with 65,000 recharge, 12,700 thrust, 7.3 million power storage with 888,000 e/s.

Weapons consist of two arrays of four missiles, with 15 second reload on either one, with twin rapid-fire cannons. (20,000 DPS)

IIRC, the combined 8-missile salvo would do 2-4 million damage.

The ship was also capable of insta-jumping, as all my ships are. (I focus a lot on that) It had ~5000 jump drive modules, and could charge the drive in ~3-4 seconds, which meant that before it emerged from the previous jump, it could jump again, and I often did so.

EDIT: I say "had" because unfortunately I lost that ship to a player pirate faction raid, along with my megaminer, refinery station, and jumpship.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-12T22:48:02Z" title="08/12/2015 10:48  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 12, 2015</time> by Starwhip**

> The ship I posted above, oddly enough, is basically a smaller version of the 80k block one you just described. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Was that where you got the idea for the aurerrian star?

> 
> The ship I posted above, oddly enough, is basically a smaller version of the 80k block one you just described. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
> ~62,000 blocks, 678,000 shield hitpoints with 65,000 recharge, 12,700 thrust, 7.3 million power storage with 888,000 e/s.
> 
> Weapons consist of two arrays of four missiles, with 15 second reload on either one, with twin rapid-fire cannons. (20,000 DPS)
> 
> IIRC, the combined 8-missile salvo would do 2-4 million damage.
> 
> The ship was also capable of insta-jumping, as all my ships are. (I focus a lot on that) It had ~5000 jump drive modules, and could charge the drive in ~3-4 seconds, which meant that before it emerged from the previous jump, it could jump again, and I often did so.
> 
> EDIT: I say "had" because unfortunately I lost that ship to a player pirate faction raid, along with my megaminer, refinery station, and jumpship.

How'd you lose them? Home bases are protected, right? They weren't docked at the faction home?

> 
> Was that where you got the idea for the aurerrian star?

No, not really. That ship was called *Kalzoria Star*, though mostly because it was convenient to name it after something like that. Note that Aurerra and all related to it was from WAY before I started playing StarMade or doing that RP.

> 
> How'd you lose them? Home bases are protected, right? They weren't docked at the faction home?

No, I'd made a refinery outpost (it had four of each type of factory, and could produce in multiples of 1, 10, 100, or 1000) and docked my ships there. It relieved the stress on my computer, loading up all the ships docked at home base was starting to kill it. XD

I got my standard mining ship back a while ago (AUS-1 Miner), it was docked at the faction base the last time I logged on. 10,000 salvagers arranged in groups of 20, two groups thick. Ate through asteroids like a hot knife through butter, had 170,000 shield hitpoints, and a 2-second-charge jump drive. At one point it also had 4 point defense cannons (Before I stripped the original down to make the megaminer. I forget which one I spawned in from the blueprints I had).
Starwhip or someone, when i start playing, someone is going to have to,teach me this game. I...completely failed in space engineers because i,got bored.
Can one of the Nextech people post here when they log onto the server?

Right, I'm heading on now, look for Jeremy\_Kerman on the playerlist.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T16:52:52Z" title="08/13/2015 04:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by [ Jeremy ]**

I'll be online in just a moment

EDIT: Made it to your base. I'll try to help you guys construct future ships and such. Also, give your Helios Class destroyer a name!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T18:54:18Z" title="08/13/2015 06:54  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Noname117**
Somehow your guys' main base moved away from the shop. My game may have loaded wrong, or the server may have done something. IDK what happened.

> 
> Somehow your guys' main base moved away from the shop. My game may have loaded wrong, or the server may have done something. IDK what happened.

That would most likely be a server/local glitch. I've had it happen before, just restart (multiple times if necessary) your game.
Alright. I'm headed off now, but I do want to know what you guys want me to do and what ships you want me to do to complete said tasks. It would be nice if you logged on a bit more often, though.

I'd assume this has been disbanded? (THREAD RESURRECTION!)

If not, i finally figured out how to play. (Not very good at it though)
Did Starmade ever fix that problem where computers with Intel processors couldn't run the game? If they did, I will consider trying it out again.
I never had that problem in the first place, I use an Intel I5 and built in intel graphics and i get 60-120 FPS (Stations bring it down to 10 lol)
The latest versions of Starmade shouln't suffer from that bug, but if your'e using an Nvdia-based video card then there may be a few issues AFAIK.
